channel.title: png Tutorial on
channel.description: Recent content in png Tutorial on

item.title: Getting started with png
item.description: libpng version 1.6.21 # Libpng was written as a companion to PNG specification as a way of reducing the amount of time and effort it takes to support the PNG file format in application programs. Libpng was designed to handle multiple sessions at one time, to be easily modifiable, to be portable to the vast majority of machines (ANSI, K&R, 16-, 32-, and 64-bit) available, and to be easy to use.

item.title: Building and installing your own libpng from source
item.description: Simple “cmake” build and install # If you want to use “cmake” (see www.cmake.org), type cd [your libpng source directory] cmake . -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/path make make install where “/path” points to the installation directory where you want to put the libpng “lib”, “include”, and “bin” subdirectories. Building and installing libpng with “git” and “configure” # This will download libpng from the official “git” repository and build it in your “libpng” directory.

item.title: Downloading and installing libpng from a distro
item.description: Ubuntu, Debian, Mint (apt-based systems) # sudo apt-get install libpng-dev on an x86_64 Ubuntu system, this installs libpng version 1.2.x in libpng12.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpng12.so.0 Fedora, RHEL, CentOS (yum-based systems) # sudo yum install libpng-devel
